intro: Oreocarya revealii, commonly known as the Sierra madre dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, while its flowers are yellow with a white or pale green center. Oreocarya revealii is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
